member.name: T:Azylee.Core.AppUtils.AppConfigUtils.AppConfig`1
member.summary:
AppConfig 配置管理器
如何使用： 1. JSON工具中，已实现了基于JSO格式的配置管理器（即转换为JSON保存为文件） 2. 如果需要实现其他方式的配置管理，如：二进制文件、ini文件、数据库，可继承并实现对应方法

member.name: M:Azylee.Core.DataUtils.EncryptUtils.MD5OTool.To16Array(System.Byte[])
member.summary:
转化byte数组为uint数组，数组长度为16的倍数
1、字符串转化为字节数组，每4个字节转化为一个uint，依次存储到uint数组 2、附加0x80作为最后一个字节 3、在uint数组最后位置记录文件字节长度信息

member.name: M:Azylee.Core.DataUtils.EncryptUtils.MD5OTool.To16Array(System.String)
member.summary:

member.name: M:Azylee.Core.DataUtils.EncryptUtils.MD5OTool.To16Array(System.IO.FileInfo)
member.summary:
转化文件为uint数组，数组长度为16的倍数
1、读取文件字节信息，每4个字节转化为一个uint，依次存储到uint数组 2、附加0x80作为最后一个字节 3、在uint数组最后位置记录文件字节长度信息

member.summary: A percentage value that represents the signal quality of the network. This field contains a value between 0 and 100. A value of 0 implies an actual RSSI signal strength of -100 dbm. A value of 100 implies an actual RSSI signal strength of -50 dbm. You can calculate the RSSI signal strength value for values between 1 and 99 using linear interpolation.

member.name: T:Azylee.Core.NetUtils.WifiManUtils.Wlan.WlanConnectionFlags
member.summary: Defines flags which affect connecting to a WLAN network.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.NetUtils.WifiManUtils.Wlan.WlanConnectionFlags.HiddenNetwork
member.summary:
Connect to the destination network even if the destination is a hidden network. A hidden network does not broadcast its SSID. Do not use this flag if the destination network is an ad-hoc network.
If the profile specified by is not null, then this flag is ignored and the nonBroadcast profile element determines whether to connect to a hidden network.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.NetUtils.WifiManUtils.Wlan.WlanConnectionFlags.AdhocJoinOnly
member.summary: Do not form an ad-hoc network. Only join an ad-hoc network if the network already exists. Do not use this flag if the destination network is an infrastructure network.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.NetUtils.WifiManUtils.Wlan.WlanConnectionFlags.IgnorePrivacyBit
member.summary: Ignore the privacy bit when connecting to the network. Ignoring the privacy bit has the effect of ignoring whether packets are encryption and ignoring the method of encryption used. Only use this flag when connecting to an infrastructure network using a temporary profile.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.NetUtils.WifiManUtils.Wlan.WlanConnectionFlags.EapolPassthrough
member.summary: Exempt EAPOL traffic from encryption and decryption. This flag is used when an application must send EAPOL traffic over an infrastructure network that uses Open authentication and WEP encryption. This flag must not be used to connect to networks that require 802.1X authentication. This flag is only valid when is set to . Avoid using this flag whenever possible.

member.name: T:Azylee.Core.NetUtils.WifiManUtils.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm
member.summary: Defines a wireless LAN authentication algorithm.
member.remarks: Corresponds to the native DOT11_AUTH_ALGORITHM type.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.NetUtils.WifiManUtils.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm.IEEE80211_Open
member.summary: Specifies an IEEE 802.11 Open System authentication algorithm.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.NetUtils.WifiManUtils.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm.IEEE80211_SharedKey
member.summary: Specifies an 802.11 Shared Key authentication algorithm that requires the use of a pre-shared Wired Equivalent Privacy (WEP) key for the 802.11 authentication.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.NetUtils.WifiManUtils.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm.WPA
member.summary:
Specifies a Wi-Fi Protected Access (WPA) algorithm. IEEE 802.1X port authentication is performed by the supplicant, authenticator, and authentication server. Cipher keys are dynamically derived through the authentication process.
This algorithm is valid only for BSS types of .
When the WPA algorithm is enabled, the 802.11 station will associate only with an access point whose beacon or probe responses contain the authentication suite of type 1 (802.1X) within the WPA information element (IE).

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.NetUtils.WifiManUtils.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm.WPA_PSK
member.summary:
Specifies a WPA algorithm that uses preshared keys (PSK). IEEE 802.1X port authentication is performed by the supplicant and authenticator. Cipher keys are dynamically derived through a preshared key that is used on both the supplicant and authenticator.
This algorithm is valid only for BSS types of .
When the WPA PSK algorithm is enabled, the 802.11 station will associate only with an access point whose beacon or probe responses contain the authentication suite of type 2 (preshared key) within the WPA IE.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.NetUtils.WifiManUtils.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm.WPA_None
member.summary: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.NetUtils.WifiManUtils.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm.RSNA
member.summary:
Specifies an 802.11i Robust Security Network Association (RSNA) algorithm. WPA2 is one such algorithm. IEEE 802.1X port authentication is performed by the supplicant, authenticator, and authentication server. Cipher keys are dynamically derived through the authentication process.
This algorithm is valid only for BSS types of .
When the RSNA algorithm is enabled, the 802.11 station will associate only with an access point whose beacon or probe responses contain the authentication suite of type 1 (802.1X) within the RSN IE.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.NetUtils.WifiManUtils.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm.RSNA_PSK
member.summary:
Specifies an 802.11i RSNA algorithm that uses PSK. IEEE 802.1X port authentication is performed by the supplicant and authenticator. Cipher keys are dynamically derived through a preshared key that is used on both the supplicant and authenticator.
This algorithm is valid only for BSS types of .
When the RSNA PSK algorithm is enabled, the 802.11 station will associate only with an access point whose beacon or probe responses contain the authentication suite of type 2(preshared key) within the RSN IE.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.NetUtils.WifiManUtils.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm.IHV_Start
member.summary: Indicates the start of the range that specifies proprietary authentication algorithms that are developed by an IHV.
member.remarks: This enumerator is valid only when the miniport driver is operating in Extensible Station (ExtSTA) mode.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.NetUtils.WifiManUtils.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm.IHV_End
member.summary: Indicates the end of the range that specifies proprietary authentication algorithms that are developed by an IHV.
member.remarks: This enumerator is valid only when the miniport driver is operating in Extensible Station (ExtSTA) mode.

member.name: T:Azylee.Core.NetUtils.WifiManUtils.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm
member.summary: Defines a cipher algorithm for data encryption and decryption.
member.remarks: Corresponds to the native DOT11_CIPHER_ALGORITHM type.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.NetUtils.WifiManUtils.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.None
member.summary: Specifies that no cipher algorithm is enabled or supported.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.NetUtils.WifiManUtils.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.WEP40
member.summary: Specifies a Wired Equivalent Privacy (WEP) algorithm, which is the RC4-based algorithm that is specified in the 802.11-1999 standard. This enumerator specifies the WEP cipher algorithm with a 40-bit cipher key.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.NetUtils.WifiManUtils.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.TKIP
member.summary: Specifies a Temporal Key Integrity Protocol (TKIP) algorithm, which is the RC4-based cipher suite that is based on the algorithms that are defined in the WPA specification and IEEE 802.11i-2004 standard. This cipher also uses the Michael Message Integrity Code (MIC) algorithm for forgery protection.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.NetUtils.WifiManUtils.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.CCMP
member.summary: Specifies an AES-CCMP algorithm, as specified in the IEEE 802.11i-2004 standard and RFC 3610. Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) is the encryption algorithm defined in FIPS PUB 197.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.NetUtils.WifiManUtils.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.WEP104
member.summary: Specifies a WEP cipher algorithm with a 104-bit cipher key.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.NetUtils.WifiManUtils.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.WPA_UseGroup
member.summary: Specifies a Robust Security Network (RSN) Use Group Key cipher suite. For more information about the Use Group Key cipher suite, refer to Clause 7.3.2.9.1 of the IEEE 802.11i-2004 standard.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.NetUtils.WifiManUtils.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.RSN_UseGroup
member.summary: Specifies a Wifi Protected Access (WPA) Use Group Key cipher suite. For more information about the Use Group Key cipher suite, refer to Clause 7.3.2.9.1 of the IEEE 802.11i-2004 standard.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.NetUtils.WifiManUtils.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.WEP
member.summary: Specifies a WEP cipher algorithm with a cipher key of any length.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.NetUtils.WifiManUtils.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.IHV_Start
member.summary: Specifies the start of the range that is used to define proprietary cipher algorithms that are developed by an independent hardware vendor (IHV).

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.NetUtils.WifiManUtils.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.IHV_End
member.summary: Specifies the end of the range that is used to define proprietary cipher algorithms that are developed by an IHV.

member.summary: Deletes a profile.
member.param: The name of the profile to be deleted. Profile names are case-sensitive. On Windows XP SP2, the supplied name must match the profile name derived automatically from the SSID of the network. For an infrastructure network profile, the SSID must be supplied for the profile name. For an ad hoc network profile, the supplied name must be the SSID of the ad hoc network followed by -adhoc.

member.name: M:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.PermissionAPI.AllocateAndInitializeSid(System.Byte[],System.Byte,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: The AllocateAndInitializeSid function allocates and initializes a security identifier (SID) with up to eight subauthorities.
member.param: Pointer to a SID_IDENTIFIER_AUTHORITY structure, giving the top-level identifier authority value to set in the SID.

Specifies the number of subauthorities to place in the SID. This parameter also identifies how many of the subauthority parameters have meaningful values. This parameter must contain a value from 1 to 8.
Subauthority value to place in the SID.
Subauthority value to place in the SID.
Subauthority value to place in the SID.
Subauthority value to place in the SID.
Subauthority value to place in the SID.
Subauthority value to place in the SID.
Subauthority value to place in the SID.
Subauthority value to place in the SID.
Pointer to a variable that receives the pointer to the allocated and initialized SID structure.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.PermissionAPI.CheckTokenMembership(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Int32@)
member.summary: The CheckTokenMembership function determines whether a specified SID is enabled in an access token.
member.param: Handle to an access token. The handle must have TOKEN_QUERY access to the token. The token must be an impersonation token.
Pointer to a SID structure. The CheckTokenMembership function checks for the presence of this SID in the user and group SIDs of the access token.
Pointer to a variable that receives the results of the check. If the SID is present and has the SE_GROUP_ENABLED attribute, IsMember returns TRUE; otherwise, it returns FALSE.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.PermissionAPI.FreeSid(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The FreeSid function frees a security identifier (SID) previously allocated by using the AllocateAndInitializeSid function.
member.param: Pointer to the SID structure to free.
member.returns: This function does not return a value.

member.name: T:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.DeviceContextValues
member.summary: Values to pass to the GetDCEx method.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.DeviceContextValues.Window
member.summary: DCX_WINDOW: Returns a DC that corresponds to the window rectangle rather than the client rectangle.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.DeviceContextValues.Cache
member.summary: DCX_CACHE: Returns a DC from the cache, rather than the OWNDC or CLASSDC window. Essentially overrides CS_OWNDC and CS_CLASSDC.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.DeviceContextValues.NoResetAttrs
member.summary: DCX_NORESETATTRS: Does not reset the attributes of this DC to the default attributes when this DC is released.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.DeviceContextValues.ClipChildren
member.summary: DCX_CLIPCHILDREN: Excludes the visible regions of all child windows below the window identified by hWnd.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.DeviceContextValues.ClipSiblings
member.summary: DCX_CLIPSIBLINGS: Excludes the visible regions of all sibling windows above the window identified by hWnd.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.DeviceContextValues.ParentClip
member.summary: DCX_PARENTCLIP: Uses the visible region of the parent window. The parent's WS_CLIPCHILDREN and CS_PARENTDC style bits are ignored. The origin is set to the upper-left corner of the window identified by hWnd.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.DeviceContextValues.ExcludeRgn
member.summary: DCX_EXCLUDERGN: The clipping region identified by hrgnClip is excluded from the visible region of the returned DC.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.DeviceContextValues.IntersectRgn
member.summary: DCX_INTERSECTRGN: The clipping region identified by hrgnClip is intersected with the visible region of the returned DC.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.DeviceContextValues.ExcludeUpdate
member.summary: DCX_EXCLUDEUPDATE: Unknown...Undocumented

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.DeviceContextValues.IntersectUpdate
member.summary: DCX_INTERSECTUPDATE: Unknown...Undocumented

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.DeviceContextValues.LockWindowUpdate
member.summary: DCX_LOCKWINDOWUPDATE: Allows drawing even if there is a LockWindowUpdate call in effect that would otherwise exclude this window. Used for drawing during tracking.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.DeviceContextValues.UseStyle
member.summary: DCX_USESTYLE: Undocumented, something related to WM_NCPAINT message.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.DeviceContextValues.Validate
member.summary: DCX_VALIDATE When specified with DCX_INTERSECTUPDATE, causes the DC to be completely validated. Using this function with both DCX_INTERSECTUPDATE and DCX_VALIDATE is identical to using the BeginPaint function.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.RedrawWindowFlags.Invalidate
member.summary: Invalidates the rectangle or region that you specify in lprcUpdate or hrgnUpdate. You can set only one of these parameters to a non-NULL value. If both are NULL, RDW_INVALIDATE invalidates the entire window.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.RedrawWindowFlags.InternalPaint
member.summary: Causes the OS to post a WM_PAINT message to the window regardless of whether a portion of the window is invalid.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.RedrawWindowFlags.Erase
member.summary: Causes the window to receive a WM_ERASEBKGND message when the window is repainted. Specify this value in combination with the RDW_INVALIDATE value; otherwise, RDW_ERASE has no effect.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.RedrawWindowFlags.Validate
member.summary: Validates the rectangle or region that you specify in lprcUpdate or hrgnUpdate. You can set only one of these parameters to a non-NULL value. If both are NULL, RDW_VALIDATE validates the entire window. This value does not affect internal WM_PAINT messages.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.RedrawWindowFlags.NoErase
member.summary: Suppresses any pending WM_ERASEBKGND messages.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.RedrawWindowFlags.NoChildren
member.summary: Excludes child windows, if any, from the repainting operation.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.RedrawWindowFlags.AllChildren
member.summary: Includes child windows, if any, in the repainting operation.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.RedrawWindowFlags.UpdateNow
member.summary: Causes the affected windows, which you specify by setting the RDW_ALLCHILDREN and RDW_NOCHILDREN values, to receive WM_ERASEBKGND and WM_PAINT messages before the RedrawWindow returns, if necessary.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.RedrawWindowFlags.EraseNow
member.summary: Causes the affected windows, which you specify by setting the RDW_ALLCHILDREN and RDW_NOCHILDREN values, to receive WM_ERASEBKGND messages before RedrawWindow returns, if necessary. The affected windows receive WM_PAINT messages at the ordinary time.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.SetWindowPosFlags.AsynWindowPos
member.summary: If the calling thread and the thread that owns the window are attached to different input queues, the system posts the request to the thread that owns the window. This prevents the calling thread from blocking its execution while other threads process the request.
member.remarks: SWP_ASYNCWINDOWPOS

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.SetWindowPosFlags.DeferErase
member.summary: Prevents generation of the WM_SYNCPAINT message.
member.remarks: SWP_DEFERERASE

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.SetWindowPosFlags.DrawFrame
member.summary: Draws a frame (defined in the window's class description) around the window.
member.remarks: SWP_DRAWFRAME

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.SetWindowPosFlags.FrameChanged
member.summary: Applies new frame styles set using the SetWindowLong function. Sends a WM_NCCALCSIZE message to the window, even if the window's size is not being changed. If this flag is not specified, WM_NCCALCSIZE is sent only when the window's size is being changed.
member.remarks: SWP_FRAMECHANGED

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.SetWindowPosFlags.HideWindow
member.summary: Hides the window.
member.remarks: SWP_HIDEWINDOW

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.SetWindowPosFlags.NoActivate
member.summary: Does not activate the window. If this flag is not set, the window is activated and moved to the top of either the topmost or non-topmost group (depending on the setting of the hWndInsertAfter parameter).
member.remarks: SWP_NOACTIVATE

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.SetWindowPosFlags.NoCopyBits
member.summary: Discards the entire contents of the client area. If this flag is not specified, the valid contents of the client area are saved and copied back into the client area after the window is sized or repositioned.
member.remarks: SWP_NOCOPYBITS

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.SetWindowPosFlags.NoMove
member.summary: Retains the current position (ignores X and Y parameters).
member.remarks: SWP_NOMOVE

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.SetWindowPosFlags.NoOwnerZOrder
member.summary: Does not change the owner window's position in the Z order.
member.remarks: SWP_NOOWNERZORDER

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.SetWindowPosFlags.NoRedraw
member.summary: Does not redraw changes. If this flag is set, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, the nonclient area (including the title bar and scroll bars), and any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of the window being moved. When this flag is set, the application must explicitly invalidate or redraw any parts of the window and parent window that need redrawing.
member.remarks: SWP_NOREDRAW

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.SetWindowPosFlags.NoReposition
member.summary: Same as the SWP_NOOWNERZORDER flag.
member.remarks: SWP_NOREPOSITION

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.SetWindowPosFlags.NoSendChanging
member.summary: Prevents the window from receiving the WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING message.
member.remarks: SWP_NOSENDCHANGING

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.SetWindowPosFlags.NoSize
member.summary: Retains the current size (ignores the cx and cy parameters).
member.remarks: SWP_NOSIZE

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.SetWindowPosFlags.NoZOrder
member.summary: Retains the current Z order (ignores the hWndInsertAfter parameter).
member.remarks: SWP_NOZORDER

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.SetWindowPosFlags.ShowWindow
member.summary: Displays the window.
member.remarks: SWP_SHOWWINDOW

member.name: T:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStyles
member.summary: Window Styles. The following styles can be specified wherever a window style is required. After the control has been created, these styles cannot be modified, except as noted.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStyles.WS_BORDER
member.summary: The window has a thin-line border.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStyles.WS_CAPTION
member.summary: The window has a title bar (includes the WS_BORDER style).

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStyles.WS_CHILD
member.summary: The window is a child window. A window with this style cannot have a menu bar. This style cannot be used with the WS_POPUP style.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStyles.WS_CLIPCHILDREN
member.summary: Excludes the area occupied by child windows when drawing occurs within the parent window. This style is used when creating the parent window.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStyles.WS_CLIPSIBLINGS
member.summary: Clips child windows relative to each other; that is, when a particular child window receives a WM_PAINT message, the WS_CLIPSIBLINGS style clips all other overlapping child windows out of the region of the child window to be updated. If WS_CLIPSIBLINGS is not specified and child windows overlap, it is possible, when drawing within the client area of a child window, to draw within the client area of a neighboring child window.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStyles.WS_DISABLED
member.summary: The window is initially disabled. A disabled window cannot receive input from the user. To change this after a window has been created, use the EnableWindow function.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStyles.WS_DLGFRAME
member.summary: The window has a border of a style typically used with dialog boxes. A window with this style cannot have a title bar.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStyles.WS_GROUP
member.summary: The window is the first control of a group of controls. The group consists of this first control and all controls defined after it, up to the next control with the WS_GROUP style. The first control in each group usually has the WS_TABSTOP style so that the user can move from group to group. The user can subsequently change the keyboard focus from one control in the group to the next control in the group by using the direction keys. You can turn this style on and off to change dialog box navigation. To change this style after a window has been created, use the SetWindowLong function.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStyles.WS_HSCROLL
member.summary: The window has a horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStyles.WS_MAXIMIZE
member.summary: The window is initially maximized.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStyles.WS_MAXIMIZEBOX
member.summary: The window has a maximize button. Cannot be combined with the WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP style. The WS_SYSMENU style must also be specified.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStyles.WS_MINIMIZE
member.summary: The window is initially minimized.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStyles.WS_MINIMIZEBOX
member.summary: The window has a minimize button. Cannot be combined with the WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP style. The WS_SYSMENU style must also be specified.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStyles.WS_OVERLAPPED
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStyles.WS_POPUP
member.summary: The window is a pop-up window. This style cannot be used with the WS_CHILD style.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStyles.WS_SIZEFRAME
member.summary: The window has a sizing border.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStyles.WS_SYSMENU
member.summary: The window has a window menu on its title bar. The WS_CAPTION style must also be specified.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStyles.WS_TABSTOP
member.summary: The window is a control that can receive the keyboard focus when the user presses the TAB key. Pressing the TAB key changes the keyboard focus to the next control with the WS_TABSTOP style. You can turn this style on and off to change dialog box navigation. To change this style after a window has been created, use the SetWindowLong function. For user-created windows and modeless dialogs to work with tab stops, alter the message loop to call the IsDialogMessage function.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStyles.WS_VISIBLE
member.summary: The window is initially visible. This style can be turned on and off by using the ShowWindow or SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStyles.WS_VSCROLL
member.summary: The window has a vertical scroll bar.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_ACCEPTFILES
member.summary: Specifies that a window created with this style accepts drag-drop files.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_APPWINDOW
member.summary: Forces a top-level window onto the taskbar when the window is visible.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_CLIENTEDGE
member.summary: Specifies that a window has a border with a sunken edge.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_COMPOSITED
member.summary: Windows XP: Paints all descendants of a window in bottom-to-top painting order using double-buffering. For more information, see Remarks. This cannot be used if the window has a class style of either CS_OWNDC or CS_CLASSDC.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP
member.summary: Includes a question mark in the title bar of the window. When the user clicks the question mark, the cursor changes to a question mark with a pointer. If the user then clicks a child window, the child receives a WM_HELP message. The child window should pass the message to the parent window procedure, which should call the WinHelp function using the HELP_WM_HELP command. The Help application displays a pop-up window that typically contains help for the child window. WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP cannot be used with the WS_MAXIMIZEBOX or WS_MINIMIZEBOX styles.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT
member.summary: The window itself contains child windows that should take part in dialog box navigation. If this style is specified, the dialog manager recurses into children of this window when performing navigation operations such as handling the TAB key, an arrow key, or a keyboard mnemonic.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_DLGMODALFRAME
member.summary: Creates a window that has a double border; the window can, optionally, be created with a title bar by specifying the WS_CAPTION style in the dwStyle parameter.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_LAYERED
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: Creates a layered window. Note that this cannot be used for child windows. Also, this cannot be used if the window has a class style of either CS_OWNDC or CS_CLASSDC.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_LAYOUTRTL
member.summary: Arabic and Hebrew versions of Windows 98/Me, Windows 2000/XP: Creates a window whose horizontal origin is on the right edge. Increasing horizontal values advance to the left.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_LEFT
member.summary: Creates a window that has generic left-aligned properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_LEFTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading order alignment, the vertical scroll bar (if present) is to the left of the client area. For other languages, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_LTRREADING
member.summary: The window text is displayed using left-to-right reading-order properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_MDICHILD
member.summary: Creates a multiple-document interface (MDI) child window.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_NOACTIVATE
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: A top-level window created with this style does not become the foreground window when the user clicks it. The system does not bring this window to the foreground when the user minimizes or closes the foreground window. To activate the window, use the SetActiveWindow or SetForegroundWindow function. The window does not appear on the taskbar by default. To force the window to appear on the taskbar, use the WS_EX_APPWINDOW style.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_NOINHERITLAYOUT
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: A window created with this style does not pass its window layout to its child windows.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_NOPARENTNOTIFY
member.summary: Specifies that a child window created with this style does not send the WM_PARENTNOTIFY message to its parent window when it is created or destroyed.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW
member.summary: Combines the WS_EX_CLIENTEDGE and WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE styles.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_PALETTEWINDOW
member.summary: Combines the WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE, WS_EX_TOOLWINDOW, and WS_EX_TOPMOST styles.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_RIGHT
member.summary: The window has generic "right-aligned" properties. This depends on the window class. This style has an effect only if the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading-order alignment; otherwise, the style is ignored. Using the WS_EX_RIGHT style for static or edit controls has the same effect as using the SS_RIGHT or ES_RIGHT style, respectively. Using this style with button controls has the same effect as using BS_RIGHT and BS_RIGHTBUTTON styles.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_RIGHTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: Vertical scroll bar (if present) is to the right of the client area. This is the default.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_RTLREADING
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading-order alignment, the window text is displayed using right-to-left reading-order properties. For other languages, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_STATICEDGE
member.summary: Creates a window with a three-dimensional border style intended to be used for items that do not accept user input.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_TOOLWINDOW
member.summary: Creates a tool window; that is, a window intended to be used as a floating toolbar. A tool window has a title bar that is shorter than a normal title bar, and the window title is drawn using a smaller font. A tool window does not appear in the taskbar or in the dialog that appears when the user presses ALT+TAB. If a tool window has a system menu, its icon is not displayed on the title bar. However, you can display the system menu by right-clicking or by typing ALT+SPACE.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_TOPMOST
member.summary: Specifies that a window created with this style should be placed above all non-topmost windows and should stay above them, even when the window is deactivated. To add or remove this style, use the SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_TRANSPARENT
member.summary: Specifies that a window created with this style should not be painted until siblings beneath the window (that were created by the same thread) have been painted. The window appears transparent because the bits of underlying sibling windows have already been painted. To achieve transparency without these restrictions, use the SetWindowRgn function.

member.name: F:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE
member.summary: Specifies that a window has a border with a raised edge.

member.name: M:Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.SetWindowLong(System.IntPtr,Azylee.Core.WindowsUtils.APIUtils.WinDrawUtils.WindowsDrawAPI.WindowLongFlags,System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes an attribute of the specified window. The function also sets the 32-bit (long) value at the specified offset into the extra window memory.
member.param: A handle to the window and, indirectly, the class to which the window belongs..
GWL_EXSTYLE, GWL_HINSTANCE, GWL_ID, GWL_STYLE, GWL_USERDATA, GWL_WNDPROC
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the previous value of the specified 32-bit integer. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.
